value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">16</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The road led to the old graves, to the stones where the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">old pagan English had offered sacrifice. The peasants still</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">went that way, in 
            <choice>
              <sic>spir ng</sic>
              <corr>spring</corr>
            </choice>, summer and winter, by instinct.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The old Gods 
            <choice>
              <sic>stil</sic>
              <corr>still</corr>
            </choice> lay hidden beneath the new.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Even if they were now nameless, it was to txxxxx do them</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">homage, to win crops, husbands, health, that the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">peasants came amxmxmxmxmxmxm in spring summer and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">winter.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is the printing press that we owe their</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">preservation. <quote source="#" rend="inline">"After that I had accomplished and 
            <choice>
              <sic>finsihed</sic>
              <corr>finished</corr>
            </choice></quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">divers histories"</quote> <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wcax" key="Caxton, William">Caxton</rs> wrote in 
            <choice>
              <sic>41470</sic>
              <corr>1470</corr>
            </choice> in the preface</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-mort" key="Morte d'Arthur">Morte DArthur</rs>, <quote source="#">"many noble and divers gentlemen</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">of this realm of England came and demanded me many and oft</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">times ..... to imprint the history of the said noble king</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">and conqueror <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-kart" key="Arthur (King)">King Arthur</rs>, and of his knights with the</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">history of the <rs type="object" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#obj-gral" key="Holy Gral (Sang Gral)">San greal</rs> and of the death and ending of</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">the said Arthur."</quote> The twenty one books of the Morte DArthur</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">preserve what lay 
            <choice>
              <sic>benea th</sic>
              <corr>beneath</corr>
            </choice>, <add><!-- come back to this later --></add>
            <choice>
              <sic>Ther</sic>
              <corr>there</corr>
            </choice> we tap into the deep reservoir</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of common belief that lay behind <add><!-- come back to this later --> </add>the peasant and the noble.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The 
            <choice>
              <sic>legnd</sic>
              <corr>legend</corr>
            </choice> was still alive in the nineteenth century.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"...folks do say"</quote> said a peasant at <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-cadb" key="Cadbury">Cadbury</rs> <quote source="#">that on the</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">night of the full moon King 
            <choice>
              <sic>Arthus</sic>
              <corr>Arthur</corr>
            </choice> and his men ride round</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">the hill, and their horses are shod with silver..."</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">A silver horseshoe, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-jlel" key="Leland, John">Leland</rs> says, was found in <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hen8" key="Henry VIII"/></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">time at <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-came" key="Camelot">Camelot</rs>. It is in <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tmal" key="Malory, Thomas">Malorys</rs> pages that we hear the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">voice of anon murmuring in the mind of King and Queen and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">peasant, They remembered how the old King</l>
